snippet.title: Rose Ave, Glen Waverley, home sets hefty house price record - realestate.com.au
snippet.content:
, sprawls across two floors.
AN off-market deal is believed to have set a new residential price record for Glen Waverley. The French provincial-style house at , was snapped up for $4.975 million on July 19, according to LLC Real Estate Mt Waverley director Andy Lou. The price eclipses the sum paid at , which was snapped up for $4.71 million back in 2015, according to CoreLogic sales records. No. 17 was originally sold for $6 million in 2015. Mr Lou said the five-bedroom house sold to a Chinese buyer with approval from the Foreign Investment Review Board. "The buyer is from Hong Kong, where it is not as difficult to move money out of the country," Mr Lou said. "The buyer and their family will have moved in by the end of the year." He said the buyer loved the home's wide frontage, grand facade, and the luxurious interior that features Italian marble. Glen Waverley's median house price grew 0.4 per cent to $1.26 million across the 12 months to April, according to CoreLogic.
